page.title: 08GALLOWAY CREAMERY -STRANRAER
page.content: The Galloway Creamery was built in {1933,}but was rebuilt in 1966, due to the increasing butter and cheese demand in the area. The new building was opened by HRH The Princess Margaret. The creamery gets its milk from farms in the area. Some of these are Gallahill, Dunbae and Knockglass. The milk is taken to the creamery in 1 of 16 milk tankers which visit the farms daily. The creamery can handle up to{800 000 litres of milk}and{240 {000 litres}of this is used in{cheese {making,}the rest is for{butter {produce.}The creamery now makes Feta cheese, a strong, white cheese with a rubbery texture. It is wrapped in the same way as butter. The production of Feta cheese started in October 1983. It is mainly for export to Iran.
